verses.1: My son, do not forget my teaching, but keep my commands in your heart,
verses.2: for they will prolong your life many years and bring you prosperity.
verses.3: Let love and faithfulness never leave you; bind them around your neck, write them on the tablet of your heart.
verses.4: Then you will win favor and a good name in the sight of God and man.
verses.5: Trust in the LORD with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding;
verses.6: in all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight.
verses.7: Do not be wise in your own eyes; fear the LORD and shun evil.
verses.8: This will bring health to your body and nourishment to your bones.
verses.9: Honor the LORD with your wealth, with the firstfruits of all your crops;
verses.10: then your barns will be filled to overflowing, and your vats will brim over with new wine.
verses.11: My son, do not despise the LORD's discipline and do not resent his rebuke,
verses.12: because the LORD disciplines those he loves, as a father the son he delights in.
verses.13: Blessed is the man who finds wisdom, the man who gains understanding,
verses.14: for she is more profitable than silver and yields better returns than gold.
verses.15: She is more precious than rubies; nothing you desire can compare with her.
verses.17: Her ways are pleasant ways, and all her paths are peace.
verses.16: Long life is in her right hand; in her left hand are riches and honor.
verses.19: By wisdom the LORD laid the earth's foundations, by understanding he set the heavens in place;
verses.18: She is a tree of life to those who embrace her; those who lay hold of her will be blessed.
verses.21: My son, preserve sound judgment and discernment, do not let them out of your sight;
verses.20: by his knowledge the deeps were divided, and the clouds let drop the dew.
verses.23: Then you will go on your way in safety, and your foot will not stumble;
verses.22: they will be life for you, an ornament to grace your neck.
verses.25: Have no fear of sudden disaster or of the ruin that overtakes the wicked,
verses.24: when you lie down, you will not be afraid; when you lie down, your sleep will be sweet.
verses.27: Do not withhold good from those who deserve it, when it is in your power to act.
verses.26: for the LORD will be your confidence and will keep your foot from being snared.
verses.29: Do not plot harm against your neighbor, who lives trustfully near you.
verses.28: Do not say to your neighbor, "Come back later; I'll give it tomorrow"- when you now have it with you.
verses.31: Do not envy a violent man or choose any of his ways,
verses.30: Do not accuse a man for no reason- when he has done you no harm.
verses.34: He mocks proud mockers but gives grace to the humble.
verses.35: The wise inherit honor, but fools he holds up to shame.
verses.32: for the LORD detests a perverse man but takes the upright into his confidence.
verses.33: The LORD's curse is on the house of the wicked, but he blesses the home of the righteous.
